inputs_required_from_company.nutFactorK_validation: You must supply K values backed by manufacturer/test data for each lubricant you allow (this is where wet-vs-dry torque differences come from).
inputs_required_from_company.allowable_stress_at_temperature: If you want at-temperature bolt strength, source it from your licensed ASME Section II Part D allowables (temperature-dependent). Use placeholders below.

fasteners.threadSeriesDefaultRule: IF D_in>=1.0 THEN default='8UN' ELSE default='UNC' (user can override)

stud_vs_bolt.note: Same torque math; just store length, stickout, and nut engagement checks.

notes: Gasket does not appear directly in T=K*D*F. Gasket type selects the recommended method + target clamp/bolt stress window + retorque guidance.
App flow: gasket_type -> (target_method, defaults) -> compute target_bolt_load_per_bolt_F -> compute torque T using nut factor K.
If allowCalculatedTorque=false, require SpecifiedTargetTorque entry (from project spec / OEM table).

gasket_types.label: Soft cut sheet (<= 1/16 in)
warnings: Over-compression risk. Keep bolt stress lower vs spiral/kammprofile.
If leakage after heat/pressure cycle, re-check after relaxation if spec allows.

retorque.timing: after initial warm-up / first pressure cycle if procedure allows

gasket_types.label: Soft cut sheet (> 1/16 in)
warnings: Thicker soft sheet can relax more; may need re-check pass.
Avoid crushing/over-torque; verify flange parallelism and surface finish.

retorque.timing: after initial warm-up / first pressure cycle if procedure allows

gasket_types.label: PTFE sheet (virgin/filled)
warnings: PTFE creeps/relaxes (cold flow). Expect bolt load loss over time.
Consider re-torque / live-loading if required by spec.

retorque.timing: after creep interval (e.g., 4-24 hr) and/or after first thermal cycle if allowed

gasket_types.label: Expanded PTFE (ePTFE)
warnings: Better conformability than dense PTFE, still relaxes.
Do not exceed gasket manufacturer compression limits if provided.

retorque.timing: after first thermal/pressure cycle if procedure allows

gasket_types.label: Spiral wound (with inner/outer ring)
warnings: Needs enough seating stress to seal; too low = leak.
Verify correct ring type (inner/outer) and centering.

gasket_types.label: Spiral wound (no ring)
warnings: Higher blowout/handling sensitivity vs ringed style.
Ensure proper compression control; consider ringed style if possible.

gasket_types.label: Kammprofile (grooved metal + facing)
warnings: Typically tolerant with wide operating window; still follow facing limits if provided.
Check for correct facing material and damage.

gasket_types.label: Metal jacketed gasket
warnings: Can be sensitive to flange finish/flatness.
Avoid uneven seating; use strict pattern + parallelism checks.

gasket_types.label: Corrugated metal w/ facing
warnings: Requires good surface condition; inspect for radial scratches/nicks.
Follow facing compression guidance if available.

gasket_types.label: Ring Type Joint (RTJ)
warnings: Do not 'calculate' torque without an approved procedure/table; sealing depends on ring/groove geometry and controlled seating.
Verify correct ring number/material, groove condition, and alignment.

gasket_types.label: Rubber full-face (water/low pressure typical)
warnings: Easy to over-compress; watch for extrusion.
Use low target stress and even compression.

retorque.timing: after initial set if procedure allows

gasket_types.label: Flexible graphite sheet
warnings: Graphite can relax; may benefit from re-check pass depending on service.
Handle carefully; damage/tearing can cause leak paths.

retorque.timing: after first thermal cycle if allowed

BOLT_STRESS_PCT_YIELD.description: Target bolt stress as % of bolt material yield; compute F from As*Sy*pct then torque.

GASKET_STRESS.description: Target gasket compressive stress Sg; compute total clamp W=Sg*Ag then per-bolt F=W/nBolts then torque.

SPECIFIED_TARGET_TORQUE_REQUIRED.description: User must enter SpecifiedTargetTorque; app only calculates pass torques and sequence/checks.

torque_calculation.target_torque_used_rule: if specifiedTargetTorqueFtLb not null -> use it else use calculatedTargetTorqueFtLb

nut_factor_method.note: This is the common industry nut-factor relationship used in PCC-1-style practice; accuracy depends heavily on K validation.

boltNumbering.rule: Bolt #1 at ~12 o'clock; number clockwise 1..N for display and check-pass order.

sequenceLookup.note: Clockwise numbering; sequence array provides tightening order.

flange_face_damage_dropdown.label: Flange face free of scratches/nicks/gouges/burrs - especially radial damage
options: Anything other than Yes: Remediate the Problem and then Continue

flange_parallel_dropdown.label: Flange faces are parallel and centered
options: Anything other than Yes: Remediate the Problem and then Continue
